arts.ttl: Potter pressure mounts as West Ham lose again
arts.sum: Graham Potter prospects of keeping his job as West Ham manager are looking ever more bleak after Crystal Palace won 2-1 at a mutinous London Stadium.

arts.ttl: Graham Potter under more pressure after West Ham lose at home to Crystal Palace
arts.sum: West Ham 1-2 Crystal Palace: Jarrod Bowen had levelled after Jean-Philippe Mateta opened the scoring for Palace, who won all three points through Tyrick Mitchell’s fine volley

arts.ttl: Palace walls close in on Potter as dreadful West Ham beaten at home again
arts.athr: Jacob Steinberg at the London Stadium
arts.sum: Many promises were made when West Ham moved to the London Stadium in 2016 but at no point did anyone say anything about constructing a team with an unrivalled inability to repel set pieces. There was, of course, that famous line from Karren Brady about delivering a “a world-class stadium for a world-class team”. That pledge has come to look a little overambitious, though, and at this point supporters would probably settle for some defenders who can head the ball away. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: West Ham 1 – 2 Crystal Palace | Second half rally killed off at London stadium
arts.sum: West Ham started the second half with a tale of two corners: Crystal Palace‘s first attack of the second half led to a header crashing off the bar almost putting them tw0- nil down, then going down the other end and Bowen heading in Diouf’s in swinger to equalise. West Ham somewhat surprisingly back in […] Source

arts.ttl: West Ham 1-2 Crystal Palace: Heat intensifies on Graham Potter after another home defeat
arts.sum: Match report as West Ham took on Crystal Palace in their Premier League clash; Hammers are now winless in eight home Premier League games, leaving boss Graham Potter under serious pressure to keep his job

arts.ttl: West Ham 0 – 1 Crystal Palace | Half time at London Stadium
arts.sum: First hurdle overcome, with West Ham undergoing trial by corner in the first twenty minutes with Palace firing in half a dozen: All bar one were aimed under Areola’s crossbar, all safely accomplished. West Ham have a new set up, and perhaps a level of confidence growing out of the new found aeriel prowess of […] Source

arts.ttl: West Ham v Crystal Palace | West Ham’s starting XI revealed
arts.sum: Graham Potter names his side any moment for the crucial clash at London stadium against London rivals Crystal Palace. Amidst a chaotic backdrop of fan protests outside the ground, the West Ham boss will be hoping his chosen side can ignore the distractions and negative noise around the club to secure just his third home […] Source

arts.ttl: Wilson starts, Wharton returns in West Ham vs Crystal Palace LIVE!
arts.sum: As I write this from the press box you can hear the anger of the home fans outside the stadium who are protesting against the club's board. Sky Sports' Lewis Jones at The London Stadium:

arts.ttl: West Ham v Crystal Palace – line up and scores predicted for Potter’s D Day
arts.sum: Surely – in what must be Graham Potter’s must-win fixture at home – the West Ham manager will offer an aggressive set up to take on visiting Crystal Palace this afternoon. After the 3-0 victory against Nottingham Forest, last week’s humbling at the hands of Tottenham has left West Ham’s least successful – ever manager […] Source
